node.display_long_description:
"SPIDER-MAN WITH GUNS ‚Äî this is what VR was made for!"

SWARM is a fast-paced, arcade-style grapple shooter, with quick sessions, bright colorful worlds and globally competitive leaderboards that will take you back to the glory days of Arcade Games.

Armed with just a grappling hook and your handy pistols, you‚Äôll be plunged into a flow state as you grapple, shoot and battle your way to the heart of the SWARM before it‚Äôs too late. Twitch reactions won‚Äôt be enough to carry you through, you‚Äôll need to think strategically and plan your next move to stay alive.

Intense. Demanding. Exhilarating.

Did we mention hard?

---------------------
CROSS-BUY - Buy for Rift or Quest and get the other free

"Swarm could very well represent a turning point in the VR arcade genre" - VR Scout

"Swarm‚Äôs gameplay is as bold as its visuals, and...is instantly addictive" - VR Focus

"Hours of fun that makes the game hard to put down" - Gaming Trend

nodes.title: SWARM v1.0.3 is available now!
nodes.body_text:
We‚Äôre happy to announce that SWARM is now available in French, German, Japanese, Korean, and Latin American Spanish.

For our Desktop/Oculus Link users, this patch also includes support for graphics settings and a desktop spectator cam. Perfect for recording & streaming high quality video.

Thank you for playing!

Note: üì¢ indicates a change inspired by community feedback!

Localization
- The game is now available in French, German, Japanese, Korean, and Latin American Spanish.
- This is Gameplay and UI Text only, no audio. Subtitles can be enabled in Settings > Audio.
- Language selector is available in Settings > Language.

Desktop Graphics Settings (Desktop/Oculus Link ONLY)
- üì¢ Added desktop graphics settings (see Settings > Graphics)
- Disable LODs
- Increase particle counts
- More coming!
- Desktop spectator cam. This is a high resolution desktop camera with motion smoothing. Enable in Settings > Graphics.

Usability
üì¢ Added setting to disable the HUD. You can find it in Settings > Gameplay.
üì¢ Improved 180 degree thumbstick turning. Previously it was too sensitive and it was easy to accidentally trigger a 180 turn.


Don't forget to join our Discord to get the latest news and a chance to participate in future betas: https://discord.gg/kdfaVQD


-------------------


German

Wir freuen uns, euch mitteilen zu k√∂nnen, dass SWARM jetzt auf Franz√∂sisch, Deutsch, Japanisch, Koreanisch und lateinamerikanischem Spanisch verf√ºgbar ist.

F√ºr unsere Desktop/Oculus Link-Benutzer birgt dieser Patch auch Unterst√ºtzung f√ºr Grafikeinstellungen und eine Desktop-Zuschauerkamera. Perfekt zum Aufnehmen & Streamen von Videos in hoher Qualit√§t.

Desktop-Grafikeinstellungen (NUR Desktop/Oculus Link)

- Weiteres folgt!
- Desktop-Zuschauerkamera. Dies ist eine hochaufl√∂sende Desktop-Kamera mit Bewegungsabmilderung. Aktivieren √ºber Einstellungen > Grafik.

Benutzerfreundlichkeit

- üì¢ Verbessertes 180-Grad-Drehen des Daumen-Sticks. Zuvor war er zu empfindlich und man konnte sehr leicht aus Versehen eine 180er Drehung ausl√∂sen.


Vergiss nicht, unserem Discord beizutreten, um die neuesten Nachrichten zu erhalten und an zuk√ºnftigen Betas teilzunehmen: https://discord.gg/kdfaVQD

Para nuestros usuarios de escritorio/Oculus Link, este parche tambi√©n incluye soporte para ajustes de gr√°ficos y una c√°mara de espectador de escritorio. Perfecto para grabar y transmitir videos de alta calidad.

nodes.title: Game Patch: v1.0.2 has arrived!
nodes.body_text:
We are humbled by and grateful for the incredible response to our launch! This first patch contains some quality of life improvements, balancing, Phobia Mode, and fixes to various issues. Thank you for your support, and for playing SWARM!

Don't forget to join our Discord to get the latest news and a chance to participate in future betas: https://discord.gg/kdfaVQD

Note: üì¢ indicates a change inspired by community feedback!

Balancing
- üì¢ Patched Basilisk (2-5) exploit that made it possible to beat the boss in 5 seconds. Discovered by Sage, one of our longtime playtesters. In his honor there's a new "Sage Speedrunner" achievement for beating every boss in under 3 minutes! The 2-5 leaderboard has been reset, so have at it!
- üì¢ Reduced difficulty of 5-2

Features
- üì¢ Added Phobia Mode - this new setting disables sharks in Zone 1 and cloud falling in Zone 3. Access via Settings > Gameplay
- üì¢ Added "Around Me" filter to leaderboard. From now on you can use the "Global" filter to see the top of the leaderboard, and "Around Me" to see a leaderboard centered on your high score.
- üì¢ In boss levels, show time passed and potential score on the drone scoreboard
- Tweaked grapple aim so it feels more accurate. Aiming should also be easier when you're not looking at the target.

Graphics
- Reduce aliasing in Zone 4 EQ screens and various other places
- Fix some rendering issues in codex unlocks

Bug Fixes
- üì¢ Fix audio spike when loading or retrying a level
- üì¢ Fix bug where missiles sometimes don't despawn at the end of a game
- Fix various issues with boss death animation and sound
- Fix bug where tutorial UI can appear incorrect after resetting progress
- Fix bug where Scattershot boss (1-5) does two shield phases in a row
- Minor bug fixes and tweaks to the final boss

node.reviewDescription:
I've been having a blast with most VR games, but Swarm is on a whole new level. It's so simple, yet absolutely wonderful.

The floor is essentially lava, and you gotta grapple these floating platforms to keep your little pigs from touching the ground. 

The grappling hook gives real spiderman vibes, but it's more consistent with doing the monkey. Moving your controllers up and down while having a platform grappled will help propel you.

This is an arena horde game in a sense. Very few games still put me into another world like Swarm does. The graphics are pretty solid and there's enough enemy types to keep you guessing what's coming in the next wave.

Aaahhh the but... There's always a but.

There's a few weapons you can obtain as power-ups. When I say a few, we're talking a handful. I do admire most of the weapons in this game, but while beneficial I wanted more of a selection. Swarm kills it with the futuristic vibe, but there's a lack of power weapon diversity.

That's really the only downer on this title.

The shooting in Swarm is crisp like the edges of a thin pancake. Zipping around the map and flailing your arms around is half the fun! I almost lose balance everytime I play from the fast pace slaying.

This is my favorite Oculus game and I recommend it to everyone.

Don't think. 

Just buy all ready!
